Actually it cannot even open the file any longer... though the editor generated 
it...
Can you attach the file that cannot open?

Dejan, I think the problem is not with the site.xml, it is with the 
hidden .sitebuild file.

The attached file looks very wrong - it has two root 'site' elements and some 
random text in between:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>

   <description url="http://dev.eclipse.org/viewcvs/index.cgi/%7Echeckout%

Philippe, how did the file contents get into that state?
Dejan, ironically in this case I'm certain PDE is not guilty of two root 
<site> elements, because we overwrite the source wholesale ;-)

I believe it resulted from a deletion of the .sitebuild file; which occurred 
due to a CVS checkout. I had broken my update site, and wanted to revert it to 
a previous state. I suspect the only state I had persisted had never been 
build. Thus the plugins&features folders were empty, and not reflected in CVS.

Philippe, the site.xml file itself does not contain info on what features to 
build and where they should end up.  Therefore, we have to persist this info 
somewhere else (i.e. the .sitebuild file).  Make sure this file is checked in 
when you check in the site project into CVS.

PDE choked here because the file was deleted.  PDE should recreate it if the 
user deleted it, but never encountered this problem until now since this file 
is hidden.

Right, but the steps I followed are legite steps I believe. Also an accidental 
deletion could occur, and this should not cause the entire update site to be 
broken... being resilient is good...
Cherie, make sure this doesn't occur in the new editor.
